sentences.english: He stood, huddled by the open fire, gazing at the dying embers.
sentences.chinese: 他只是木然地站在爐火旁，看着那漸漸滅去的灰燼。

sentences.english: Fire and wind raged all around, snapping juniper trees and incinerating the sagebrush.
sentences.chinese: 四周風火肆虐，猛咬着杜松樹，把山艾樹燒成了灰燼。

sentences.english: Shadow disjoin dirty ash into the night…
sentences.chinese: 陰影將骯髒的灰燼分離至夜晚。

sentences.english: From its nest the bird flew down and fanned the embers with its wings.
sentences.chinese: 知更鳥從它的巢中飛下來，用它的翅膀扇着火的灰燼。

sentences.english: But it's ashes now. And I shall never go home.
sentences.chinese: 但現在它化成灰燼了，我永遠都不能回家了。

sentences.english: When anyone leaves paper money in a fire，the fire burn sit.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人把紙幣留在火裏，火就會把它燒成灰燼。

sentences.english: From the ashes of the old times a new world will arise.
sentences.chinese: 新世界將從舊時代的灰燼中華麗誕生。

sentences.english: He threw the snakeskin into the fire and watched it burn.
sentences.chinese: 他把蛇皮扔進爐子裏，眼看着被火燒成了灰燼。

sentences.english: He poked at a pile of ashes with a poker.
sentences.chinese: 他用撥火棍撥弄着一堆灰燼。

sentences.english: The building was burned (reduced) to ashes.
The fire reduced the house to ashes.
sentences.chinese: 這場火災把那所房子化爲灰燼。

sentences.english: Taupe glass spherical ashes taste not easily broken.
sentences.chinese: 灰燼味灰褐色玻璃球狀，不易破碎。

sentences.english: Ashes were all that remained of her books after the fire.
sentences.chinese: 大火過後，她的書已全部化爲灰燼。

sentences.english: That is a kind of intense emotion later on remaining stay of ashes.
sentences.chinese: 那是一種激情過後所餘留的灰燼。

sentences.english: Russia has been scorched by heatwave and its forests incinerated.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯已經被熱浪烤焦，森森已經化爲灰燼。

definition: to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to peel/to strip/to peel off/to come off (of tissue, skin, covering etc)
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
to vanish gradually/to disappear/to fade out
ritual money made of paper burnt for the Gods or the dead
